frameDefinitions: A Person is in a state of prosperity and/or renown after some period of development or hardship in an Endeavor.
An Agent performs an Action incorrectly.
An Agent is performing the portion of an Activity in which there is dynamic stability. ''
The words of this frame describe how a Resource_controller spends money or other Resources for a particular purpose .
In this frame, a Resource_controller is judged by a Judge (who is usually implicit)  according to how freely they allow the Recipient access to their Resource.
A Payer gives up (or potentially gives up) the use of an Asset (generally money) in order to achieve an Intended_event.
frameExamples: Not noticing the hoards of people rushing by the window, Manny <t>continued</t> eating his lunch.
It 'll <t>cost</t> Sandra's parents fifty grand a year for her to attend that school.
listRoleDefinitions: A sentient being or group of beings that is prosperous or well known after being involved in some <fen>Endeavor</fen>.
An event that the <fen>Person</fen> is involved in which leads to their state of prosperity or renown.
The time when the <fen>Entity</fen> is determined to be successful.
The <fen>Agent</fen> performs an action incorrectly.
<fen>Patient</fen> is the entity affected by the <fen>Agent</fen>'s bungling of an <fen>Action</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Action</fen> that the <fen>Agent</fen> performs incorrectly.
The type of action that the <fen>Agent</fen> habitually bungles.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the bungling occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the bungling occurs.

Duration denotes the length of <fen>Time</fen> from the beginning of a continuous situation (the one denoted by the target) to its end. In many cases, the continuous situation is a dynamic action which is ongoing, while in others it is simply an undifferentiated state.
This role identifies the name of the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> in which an <fen>Agent</fen> engages.
The <fen>Agent</fen> engages in an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when an ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the ongoing <fen>Activity</fen> occurs.

The <fen>Resource_controller</fen> is the individual whose frugality or generosity is being described. Person typically occurs as the External Argument or, in some cases when <fen>Behavior</fen> is also expressed, in an <ment>of</ment>-PP:
Some specific <fen>Behavior</fen> may be described as frugal or extravagant, rather than attributing the characteristic directly to the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
This role is the resource which the <fen>Resource_controller</fen> expends.
The Resource_Controller is the individual who controls access to the Resource.
The Resource_controller controls the Recipient's access to the Resource.
The <fen>Recipient</fen> is the individual or individuals who receive or should receive the <fen>Resource</fen> from the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The Behavior is an action of the Resource_controller which is judged to be generous or stingy.
The <fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part which indicates the character of the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
The role <fen>Goods</fen> is the item(s) whose price is being assessed.  <fen>Goods</fen> is usually an External Argument:
The person whose <fen>Asset</fen> is given up in order to achieve an <fen>Intended_event</fen>.  This role is often expressed as INI.
The price of or payment made for the Goods.
The event that the <fen>Payer</fen> brings about by deploying the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The time when a transaction takes place.
listRoleExamples: <fex>He</fex> became a success at the age of 25.
Looking back, I had a very successful <fex>career</fex>.
After 20 years of hard work, he finally made it as an artist <fex>in '84</fex>.
The Austro-Hungarian Empire had a long history of <fex>military</fex> screw-ups.
It's thrifty of Jo <fex>to re-use teabags</fex>.
Surprising, Dad was stingy <fex>with his inheritance</fex>.
Mr. Burns is extremely miserly <fex>towards his employees</fex>.
It was generous of Jim <fex>to have us over for dinner</fex>.
A holiday in Europe is very expensive <fex>for me</fex>.
No, they've got a special on; it's really cheap there <fex>on Tuesdays</fex>
